samples.question: Regarding grammatical diversity and accuracy, what about using system mix, sample repetition, and complex paper with limited possibility?
samples.transcript: Candidates can use many structures, including simple, isolated, and complex sentence structures.

samples.question: However, flexibility is lacking.
samples.transcript: For example, they frequently repeat structures like "you have something," "deep something," etc. There is not much flexibility in Paris, as well as in other aspects. Regarding the arrangement of clauses, one can completely change the clause so that the cause comes before the effect, or vice versa. A candidate scoring 6.0 might not yet be able to arrange them flexibly. Another important point is that when it comes to more complex sentence structures, candidates often make grammatical errors, such as forgetting to conjugate verbs or using the preposition " in," "call," or "vibrant." However, the most important thing is that these errors rarely, if ever, affect the listener's understanding of the information. Let 's analyze a very clear example from the previous answers: when a candidate describes seeing a statue in the so-called monument of the People's Police, what scenes are there? The correct structure would be "de firefighters you are Trying to stop." When we shorten the relative clause, we shorten "hua" but keep "hoai" and the following situations are the same, therefore it is right to stop. The phrase or graphic " Please helping elderly people" with verbs in that position would be correct, but our candidates only use the infinitive form. Anyway.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 4]
samples.transcript: Do I start the reading and something happens and it kind of Pampers my my dampen is my concentration so I thought yeah this something is wasting my time I should do something about and that something was for example right now I am chatting with you and I have for example closed my WhatsApp window I put my phone on silent mode so that thing is switching off or if not switching off watching let us say putting my phone on silence mode closing the WhatsApp tab on my laptop signing out of my Facebook account for example but called not something but this activity helps me to concentrate like now I am chatting with you we are doing this interview so I have closed this kind of a temporarily digital detox for me I put my phone on silent mode and I cannot see the screen I have logged out of my Facebook so this activity helps me focus and what I then what I do I look at my clock for example 321 now okay 2350 I have to study and until that time no phone no checking email no WhatsApp nothing so I would say this action has helped me to concentrate to focus more on my study and this is what I tell my students as well because our students are youngsters and they are kind of they are digital natives by the way I am a digital immigrant when I was a student like when I was doing Masters 20 years ago we did not have these devices so at that time we did not have okay have it I am going to stop you there you have spoken for two minutes okay do you think you will continue this routine in the future yes I will I will I will switch off.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 5]
samples.transcript: My devices for some time and try to concentrate okay wonderful so Hannah we have been talking about a routine and something that you do that helps you to concentrate and I would like to discuss with you one or two more general questions related to this let us first of all consider concentrating at work now what do you think a boss can do to encourage his or her employees to focus and concentrate at work well a boss has kind of I would say the boss is being like a tankless job like if you if you are trying if you are strict so maybe your subordinates do not like that but I think you have to be scripted of course because a boss should first issue let us say a series of directives or instructions like for example I am a teacher so without being told by my boss though there are Journal instructions but without being told I I put on my phone on silent mode for example so boss should issue let us say straight forward clear instructions as to how the employees can concentrate and maybe there could be training sessions that he or she can organize for his employees right and you mentioned it is important for a boss to be strict a bit strict yeah not very strict a bit strict yeah I have a okay yeah it was so for example a lot of the time now as as people work remotely it is it is sometimes harder for bosses to work out whether their staff are being productive and some bosses and employers will use monitoring devices so to for example see that their staff are looking at their computers or not checking Facebook what do you think about these.

samples.question: [Transcript chunk 6]
samples.transcript: Kind of methods yes if if you work remotely and boss wants to keep a check or an item yes you have to think of such clever ideas yes but in case of let us say when we were doing our we were taking our online classes we asked our students to turn on their cameras so maybe a boss can do the same to like ask his directive employees to turn on the camera or maybe give them a task and a certain time frame for example like you have this task you can do it till let us say if it is three o'clock do it till four breakdown but so you know that you have you do not have much time you have to wait quickly because and maybe that will like put you on your toes let us say that the boss can last me giving me a very little time and I should do it quickly so it does not give me any room for any kind of let us say wasting my time or maybe using social media instead of doing my work yes and do you think that monitoring stuff and giving them rules is always the best way to boost productivity in the workplace well the answer is both yes and no so set of instructions being a little a little bit of strictness and on the other hand let us say appreciation maybe bonuses so you have to do all these things sometimes a little stiffness sometimes wherever appreciation my boss boss does that for example and whenever we do something good we are in a meeting so he asks other employees to clap for Mr or Mr and so so appreciation and finding that balance between the two exactly yeah and if we.
